title: Bob Costas steps down from Olympics, Football Night in America
text:
Manage Bob Costas steps down from Olympics, Football Night in America NBC sports legend Bob Costas announced on Thursday that he will no longer anchor coverage of the Olympics on the network and he will be replaced by Mike Tirico. Slot to 247Sports Links 
NBC sports legend Bob Costas announced on Thursday that he will no longer anchor coverage of the Olympics on the network and he will be replaced by Mike Tirico. 
“It just felt to me like the right time and it’s felt like the right time for a while,” Costas told the New York Times in an earlier interview held until release of the announcement on “Today” on Thursday morning. “This was a good time to step away, while I could still do it." 
Costas isn't the leaving the network entirely, but will be reducing his role - including giving up hosting duties of the Sunday Night NFL pregame show "Football Night in America." 
Costas began covering the Olympics for the Network in Seoul, South Korea for the 1988 Summer Games. He was the late-night host, while the primetime duties were held by Bryant Gumbel. Costas moved into the main host chair for the 1992 Barcelona Olympics and has led the coverage for each Olympics NBC has covered since. CBS televised the Winter Olympics in 1992, 1994 and 1998. 
Costas told the newspaper that he made his decision to step down prior to the Rio Games, knowing those would be his last as host before they began. 
Costas, whose love of baseball is no secret, told the paper he intends to work more with MLB Network as he scales back in other areas.
